title: Lesson 2
paragraph: This lesson focuses on verbs that describe handling objects, movement, and basic interactions — useful for daily conversations and practical tasks.

words.meaning: to separate into pieces or stop working
to carry something to a place
to construct by putting parts together
words.example: They plan to build a new bridge.

words.meaning: to decide that an arranged event will not happen
words.example: The flight was canceled due to weather.

words.meaning: to support and move something from one place to another
to capture or take hold of something
to select from two or more options
to bring things together as a group
words.example: She collects stamps as a hobby.
Compare the two products before buying.
She completed the assignment on time.

words.meaning: to direct attention or effort toward something
words.example: Concentrate on the task at hand.
